sndlib.core.problem
Class RoutingLink

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.problem.RoutingLink

public class RoutingLink
extends java.lang.Object

A RoutingLink is a component of a RoutingPath and wraps a single network link together with the direction of the corresponding flow.

Author:
Roman Klaehne

Method Summary
 Link getLink()
          Returns the corresponding network link.
 Node getSource()
          Returns the source node of the corresponding flow.
 Node getTarget()
          Returns the target node of the corresponding flow.
 boolean isPositiveDirection()
          Returns true if the link is traversed in positive direction.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

getLink

public Link getLink()
Returns the corresponding network link.

Returns:
the corresponding network link

getSource

public Node getSource()
Returns the source node of the corresponding flow. The returned node is either of the two nodes which are incident to the network link corresponding to this routing link.

Returns:
the source node of the corresponding flow path

getTarget

public Node getTarget()
Returns the target node of the corresponding flow. The returned node is either of the two nodes which are incident to the network link corresponding to this routing link.

Returns:
the target node of the corresponding flow path

isPositiveDirection

public boolean isPositiveDirection()
Returns true if the link is traversed in positive direction. A link is traversed in positive direction if the corresponding link's first node is the source of the flow.

Returns:
true if the link is traversed in positive direction; false otherwise
